availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Fontaine T. Fox, Jr. (Boyle County attorney and major in 1st KY cav)

body.p: Boyle County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of F. T. Fox and Elizabeth Fox. Attorney in Boyle County in 1860. Confirmed as a notary public in Boyle County on February 5, 1861. Major in the 1st Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) until June 4, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, p. 47.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 2-3.
Find A Grave, "Fontaine T. Fox, Jr. (1836-1926)," Memorial #105813525, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/105813525 (accessed October 3, 2018).
KYR-0001-017-0062.
